entry.content:
I'm always looking for ways to be frugal 💵 and save our beautiful planet 🌎. That's why I decided to tell you about some useful tips in the category of drying in an ecological way.

If it is possible for you to use a clothesline or a clothes dryer, I strongly recommend that you use these two methods since they are the most ecological. On the other hand, it is not always easy to spread these clothes inside when it is 30°C and very humid, especially if it concerns sheets and towels. This is why I am offering you here some tips for the electric clothes dryer and the use of woolen dryer balls.

Wool drying balls are essential allies for the electric dryer. They can save us money and save the planet. Since every little bit counts, here are some details on the benefits of drying balls:

🧶Reduce drying time

By bouncing in the dryer they separate the clothes and create greater drafts between the clothes. Which makes drying faster.

👩🏼‍🏫 Bonus, it also helps reduce static!

🌈 Less drying time = less energy spent, which means: more in your pockets and a happier 🌎!

🧶Replace fabric softeners

Do you like your clothes to smell good? No problem, buy yourself one or two essential oils and you're done! Put a few drops on your drying balls and your laundry will smell very good, very fresh! 🙂

By doing this, you'll stop spending on single-use polyester fabric softener sheets and help reduce the amount of waste that obviously ends up in the landfill.

🌈 Less buying of single-use fabric softener sheets = more in your pockets and a happier 🌎!

🌼 Essential oil blend

  • Lemon and lavender
  • Eucalyptus and lavender
  • Orange and tea tree

Just put 2-3 drops of each essential oil on your drying balls. If you are looking for essential oils, click here to get a basic kit.

Do you already use woolen drying balls? If not, do you plan to start using them?

entry.content:
Do you know how easy it is to make your own homemade all-purpose cleaner? In addition to being an ecological alternative, it is also an economical alternative without risk to health. 🙂

You'll need

  • a container
  • Citrus peels
  • vinegar
  • a vaporizer
  • water
  • a label maker (optional)

Instructions

  1. Place the citrus peels in the container.
  2. Pour the vinegar up to the rim of the container.
  3. Let the citrus infuse in the vinegar for at least 2 weeks.
  4. After two weeks, remove the citrus peels from the vinegar.
  5. Pour with a 1:1 ratio, water and citrus infused vinegar into the spray.

There you go, you are now ready to clean your home in an ecological way! 🙂
